chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Robert J. Burton in court.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Robert J. Burton.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM. Atty Corcoran requests adjmt.  Trial scheduled.  Bond continued.
Jury selection scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.   Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Corcoran filed a substitution which the notes was filed timely. Attorney Corcoran shall received notice from Branch 1 regarding scheduling new status hearing.
NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Corcoran.  Clerk. M.Burke. STC set to 08/19/22 at 2:00.
Due to an ongoing trial in br 2 the PTC is adjourned with Attorney Corcoran to 07/07/22 at 10:30

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Corcoran. Clerk/H. Barnett. State in victim witness compliance. Court quashes authorization for warrant and does not forfeit bond. PTC set for 6/15/22 at 8:30am.
With Atty Leibhan a VA is set for 3/21/22 at 2:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Kelly Leibhan appeared on behalf of the deft.  No appearance by deft.  BW authorized; $2500 cash bond & sign. bond forfeited; stayed until 3/21/22 @ 5pm.

Defendant, Robert J. Burton, appeared with Attorney Kelly Leibhan.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: KPD Ofc Jacob T, KPD Ofc M. W, KPD Ofc J. K - except in professional capacity, Wendy W.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Wendy W's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

03:14 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kelly Liebhan.
